newsitem.title: FRANCE: Protest in French port blocks altered maize cargo.
newsitem.headline: Protest in French port blocks altered maize cargo.

text.p: Protestors from the environmental group Greenpeace invaded a French port on Thursday to prevent unloading of what they said was the first shipment to Europe of genetically-modified maize, witnesses said.
The Greek freighter Magda P had moved into dock at the western port of Saint-Nazaire after the European Union cleared the modified American maize on Wednesday.
"It is certain that the maize contained in the hold of this ship has been genetically modified in the United States," one of the activists told reporters.
Neither the ship's captain nor owners could immediately be reached for comment.

About 15 people took part in the protest at the Montoire grain terminal inside Saint-Nazaire harbour, witnesses said. Greenpeace said in a statement the protestors chained themselves to cranes and silos.

The EU's executive Commission cleared the maize, developed by Swiss firm Ciba-Geigy to resist the corn borer pest and a powerful weed killer, for sale in Europe on the advice of three panels of experts.
But Greenpeace wants European governments and consumers to resist the imports, saying genetic engineering puts human health at risk.
